overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting under constraints of limited data (96 hourly points) and inability to run computational models. It systematically evaluates multiple methods before settling on a simple averaging technique, emphasizing daily seasonality capture and data completeness. The analysis is thorough in pattern identification but constrained by data scarcity.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in input data
key_insights: Prioritization of daily seasonality over trend due to short data horizon
Rejection of complex models (SARIMA, Holt-Winters) due to overfitting risks with limited data
Hourly pattern averaging as a robust solution for short-term forecasts
Explicit handling of data formatting (rounding, timestamp continuity)
Validation of pattern stability through daily average comparisons
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-step evaluation: initial consideration of advanced models followed by simplification due to data constraints, featuring detailed pattern analysis and manual computations.
